column4: how can I configure the resolution of my monitor if ubuntu just give me the option of 640x480??
does it know the correct monitor?
then try screen resolution from the menus, if that doesn't work, you will need to edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
and hence it probably doesn't know your monitor correctly
You need to know your monitors horizontal and vertical numbers
that url has the horiz and vert numbers
just edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf as root and change it to have the correct numbers
the monitor's horiz and vert numbers, which you can get from the url above
then you need to change the supported resolutions in the display section at the end of the file
what about the monitor numbers above?
your display working the way you want now?
as for win32 codecs, they are in hoary-extras, an unoffical ubuntu repo
